intro: Galianthe humilis, commonly known as the dwarf galianthe, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Galianthe humilis is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative ground cover due to its compact size and ornamental appeal.
